Sections.Name: Domains
Sections.Description: The domains listed here are some areas that may cause you to feel anxious. Please select the one from which you'd like to see resources.

Parameters.Text:
PHD+ Grant and Fellowship Writing

If you want to develop stronger grant/fellowship application writing skills or are just curious and don't know about the various opportunities, join PHD+ module program! 

https://phdplus.virginia.edu/grant-fellowship-writing



PHD+ Future Faculty

Future Faculty modules can help you to build and expand professional community for career research and preparation in faculty careers.

https://phdplus.virginia.edu/future-faculty



Application and Interview Tips

Review best practices and learn to avoid common missteps.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sLffu1MWzqU



UVA Center for Teaching Excellence

UVA's Center for Teaching Excellence (CTE) offers a variety of programs, grants, materials, and services aimed at creating innovative opportunities for teaching and learning on Grounds. 

https://cte.virginia.edu



The Office of the Vice President for Research 

Wanting to explore how research is perfomed at UVA and additional research opportunities? Check out the Office of the Vice President for Research!

https://research.virginia.edu

Lou's List 

Deciding what classes to enroll in next semester? Made for UVA students, Lou's List gives you an extensive list of class options. 

https://louslist.org/index.php?Semester=1212



The Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Affairs

The Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Affairs mission is to create an enviroment for graduate students that allows them to thrive, and offers lots of opportunities for career growth. 

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu



UVA and Charlottesville Guide

Made specifically for graduate students, the UVA and Charlottesville Guide offers resources for academics. 

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/uva-and-charlottesville-guide

SHE: Shelter for Help in Emergency

Check out SHE for a variety of trauma-informed services for helping victims of domestic violence and to help create a community of support.

https://www.shelterforhelpinemergency.org/



Free Legal Clinic through the Women's Center

Offers professional, pro-bono legal advice to Charlottesville community members every month, regarding topics including harassment, eviction, landlord-tenant disputes, etc. 

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/free-legal-clinic



myPlan App

A free app to help with safety decisions if you, or someone  you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship.  It’s private, secure, personalized, & backed by research.

https://www.myplanapp.org/

PageGroups.Name: Caring for Kids
PageGroups.Title: Family & Home Life: Caring for Kids

Parameters.Text:
UVA Programs and Activities for Kids

Looking for fun things to do with your kid(s)? Check out this resource for activities to do with children at UVA!

https://www.law.virginia.edu/charlottesville/family/activities



Resources for Students with Children

The UVA Career Center offers resources to help students who have children navigate academics and career development. 

https://career.virginia.edu/specific-populations/students-children



Charlottesville Preschools and Daycare 

UVA offers two childcare services for students, faculty, and staff and there are over 40 preschool and daycare options in the greater Charlottesville area. 

https://www.law.virginia.edu/charlottesville/family/preschools-and-daycare

PageGroups.Name: Navigating Family Life
PageGroups.Title: Family & Home Life: Navigating Family Life

Parameters.Text:
Grieving: TIPS for living in a time of loss

Advice for people struggling with the loss of a loved one.

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/2021/03/grieving-tips-living-time-loss



UVA and Charlottesville Guide

Made specifically for graduate students, the UVA and Charlottesville Guide offers resources for family and home life. 

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/uva-and-charlottesville-guide



CAPS Group Therapy: Interpersonal Process Group for Graduate Students

Having issues with family? This group helps students to understand their identity and self-worth while also learning how to improve communication with others. 

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/CAPS-groups



If You're Reading This, It's Okay to Miss Home

Are you struggling with homesickness? This story from a UVA student may help you feel less alone. 

http://www.ifyourereadingthis.org/letters/sarahp



Dealing with Homesickness

This comprehensive guide from the University of Kansas gives advice on how to cope with homesickness. 

https://caps.ku.edu/homesickness



Silvercloud - Improving Relationships

Through the unversity, undegraduate students have free access to Silvercloud, an interactive mental health resource. If you're struggling with family relationships, try out their "improving relatiinships" goal. 

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/silvercloud-online-assessments



Better Health Channel - Family Conflict

This guide from from the Better Help Channel can help you navigate conflict that might arise with your family. 

https://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/health/healthyliving/family-conflict



UVA International Students and Scholars Program

Do you have questions about being an international student? This division of the International Studies office has a plethora of resources that can help answer all of your questions. 

https://issp.virginia.edu/purpose

Peer Financial Counseling

If you need help with budgeting, loans, investing, and/or financial planning, trained counselors are here to help!

https://sfs.virginia.edu/resources-personal-finance/peer-financial-counseling



Student Financial Services

Unsure of the main financial aid dates or resources avaiable to you? Sfs has a whole website page for you! 

https://sfs.virginia.edu/financial-aid-current-students/current-graduate-students



Student Financial Services

Applying for financial aid is daunting and complicated, but SFS has resources specific to your graduate program that could help!

https://sfs.virginia.edu/financial-aid-new-applicants/how-apply-financial-aid-graduate-professional-applicants

PageGroups.Name: Grant Funding and Research Support
PageGroups.Title: Finances: Grant Funding and Research Support

Parameters.Text:
Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Affairs

If youre looking for funding but dont know where to look, the Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Affairs has a database that break down the various resources you could explore.

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/funding/looking-funding



Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Affairs

Writing an application for a research grant or fellowship funding can be confusing, but the Graduate School can help with co-sponsored workshops and tutorials for grant writing and research statements!

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/funding/workshops

Free financial planning tools

Check this out to view beginner investing tips and strategies, financial tools and calculators, and learn how to protect your investments. 

https://www.investor.gov/free-financial-planning-tools



Financial Wellness: Shifting from How Much You Have to How You Use It

Learn about what financial wellness means and how to achieve it in your own life 

https://www.eudaimonicbydesign.com/resilience/financial



Tools from UVA Community Credit Union

Interested in learning about managing your money, investing, or even buying a house? Attend a free, one-hour seminar through UVA Community Credit Union 

https://www.uvacreditunion.org/content/Education-And-Tools



7 Steps to Manage Your Money

This article from US News outlines seven steps to help you organize your finances.

https://money.usnews.com/money/personal-finance/articles/steps-to-manage-your-money

On-Grounds Housing for Graduate Students

Looking for a place to live? Housing and Residence Life offers on-grounds living options for graudate students as well as tips on finding off-grounds housing. 

https://housing.virginia.edu/graduate-students



Apartment Hunting around UVA

This Reddit forum offers insight into housing options and costs around grounds. 

https://www.reddit.com/r/UVA/comments/knkww3/grad_students_do_you_have_your_own_apartments/

UVA Mindfulness Center

Check out the Mindfulness Center for meditation and other stress-reduction online classes, events, recordings, and resources. 

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/programs/



UVA Contemplative Sciences Center

Check out the CSC for various yoga and mindfulness courses. 

https://csc.virginia.edu/feature/contemplative-classes-yoga-mindfulness-and-more



Compassionate Care Initiative

The UVA School of Nursing’s Compassionate Care Initiative (CCI) offers ongoing, weekly sessions on mindfulness meditation, mindful movement, yoga, and more. All drop-in sessions are free; no registration or previous experience required!

https://cci.nursing.virginia.edu/activities/calendar/



Tools of Transformation from eMindful

Interested in practicing mindfulness? Try eM Life, a free online mindfulness platform for UVA employees and spouses!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/emotional-well-being/mindfulness-resources/emlife



Mindfulness Meditation Group

Each week there is a 30-minute guided meditation, followed by open discussion and questions.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/



Mindfulness Information Videos

Learn more about mindfulness from two of UVA’s Mindfulness Center Instructors.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/about/intro-to-mindfulness/



Mindfulness Recommended Reading

Readings, videos, and transcripts with information on mindfulness and how to incorporate it into your lifestyle.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/recommended-reading/

CAPS Group Therapy

CAPS has a range of group therapy options including skills groups, support coups, and interpersonal process groups. Check to see if any of these offer what you are looking for!

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/group-therapy



Student Health and Wellness - Care Management

Not sure where to start? A CAPS Care Manager can help you get started and access mental health care.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/care-management-services



Student Health and Wellness - CAPS Drop-in Consults

CAPS offers drop-in consults if you ever feel like you need to talk in a safe space!

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/CAPS-services



HELP Line

Check out this free and confidential telephone hotline serving Albemarle County where volunteers can provide judgement-free listening and help refer you to long-term services.

http://www.helplineuva.com/



Partner for Mental Health

If you're looking to get help beyond UVA, Partner for Mental Health is a community-focused resource that offers assisstance to those experiencing mental health and addiction issues throughout Charlottesville.  

https://partnerformentalhealth.org/



The Counseling Alliance of Virginia (CAVA)

CAVA's mission is to provide an environment of support for individuals, couples, and families experiencing a wide range of life stressors in Charlottesville and Richmond. 

https://www.cavahelps.com/



Region Ten

Region Ten offers a variety of mental health services to people of all ages and backgrounds in the Charlottesville community and beyond. 

https://regionten.org/



TimelyCare

Free scheduled telehealth visits with a mental health provider for UVA students. Access 24/7 virtual care from anywhere!

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/timelycare



Central Virginia Clinicans of Color Network (CVCCN)

CVCCN is a supportive network that empowers clinicians of color and builds capacity for providing culturally responsive mental health treatment.

https://cvccn.org/

Self Compassion by Dr. Kristin Neff

Learn more about how you can practice self-compassion, asking how you can comfort and care for yourself in difficult moments.

https://self-compassion.org/



BIPOC Mental Health and Wellness Resources 

Check out this comprehensive guide for BIPOC mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/1/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1529019313&single=true



LGBTQ+ Mental Health and Wellness Resources 

Check out this comprehensive guide for LGBTQ+ mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1628978054&single=true

Tobacco Cessation through Student Health 

resource list only -- The Office of Health Promotion at UVA's Student Health offers a wide range of resources for students to explore relating to the decisions they make about tobacco use.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/tobacco-cessation



Formal Substance Abuse Assessment

resource list only -- At UVA’s Student Health, students can receive a free and confidential substance use assessment.  Based on in-person assessment results and recommendations, follow-up care and options can be coordinated.

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/alcohol-tobacco-other-drugs



Take an Online Self-Assessment about Substance Use

BASICS is available to any UVA student who wants to assess personal risk regarding substance use, explore potential changes, and help reduce the risk for future problems associated with alcohol or other drugs.  BASICS consists of an online survey and a one-on-one conversation with a trained facilitator to receive personalized feedback.  BASICS is confidential and free of charge.

Take an Online Self-Assessment

PageGroups.Name: Physical Health and Exercise
PageGroups.Title: Physical Health: Physical Health and Exercise

Parameters.Text:
Student Health

Look at this website if you need help navigating how to set up health insurance at UVA.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/insurance



Aquatic and Fitness Center

Take a look at some ways to stay active at UVA! The Fitness Center offers group and personal training.

https://recsports.virginia.edu/afc



UVA Walking Trails

There are a lot of places to walk around Grounds. This map will help you explore all of them!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/physical-well-being/uva-walking-paths



UVA and Charlottesville Guide

Made specifically for graduate students, the UVA and Charlottesville Guide offers resources for physical health and wellness. 

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/uva-and-charlottesville-guide

UVA Student Health Eating Disorders Consultation and Treatment Team

resource list only -- Describes Student Health’s team approach to care for students experiencing eating, body image, and/or exercise concerns and lists contact info and instructions for scheduling medical, nutritional, and psychological/psychiatric care appointments.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/eating-disorders



UVA Coalition on Eating Disorders & Exercise Concerns 

resource list only -- Committee of UVA students, faculty, and staff addressing eating disorders and exercise abuse through research, outreach, training, and resources.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/EDEC



Office of Health Promotion: Nutrition Services

Nutrition services are offered to anyone seeking advice and aid. 

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/nutrition

Planned Parenthood

Check out Planned Parenthood for both informational resources on STDs, pregnancy, birth control options, and more, or to schedule an in-person or telehealth appointment with a medical professional. 

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/



Planned Parenthood: Pregnancy Information

Check out this resource on prenatal care, fertility treatments, pregnancy options, postpartum depression, and more! 

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/learn/pregnancy



Thrive Central Virginia

Check out this center for both its 24/7 helpline and both walk-in or scheduled appointments regarding pregnancy testing, confidential options counseling, abortion information, ultrasounds, pregnancy support, post-abortion care and support, and more!  

https://thrivecentralva.org/

PageGroups.Name: Addressing Harm in Relationships
PageGroups.Title: Romantic Relationships: Addressing Harm in Relationships

Parameters.Text:
Sexual Assault Resource Agency

The Sexual Assault Resource Agency (SARA) provides free, confidential support services for survivors of all genders.   

https://saracville.org



Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE)

The Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE) offers trauma-based resources for survivors of domestic violence and aims at creating a community of empowerment and support. 

https://www.shelterforhelpinemergency.org

National Healthy Marriage Resource Center 

The National Healthy Marriage Resource Center offers a variety of resources to help married couples develop a healthier relationship. 

http://www.healthymarriageinfo.org



The Gottman Institute

The Gottman Institute is focused on improving the well-being of marriages, families, and relationships through a research-based approach. 

https://www.gottman.com/about/

PageGroups.Name: Improving Relationships and Handling Stress
PageGroups.Title: Romantic Relationships: Improving Relationships and Handling Stress

Parameters.Text:
Small Things Often Podcast

Available on Spotify and Apple Podcasts, Small Things Often offers research-based tips to help you improve your relationship every Monday and Wednesday mornings. 

https://www.gottman.com/podcast/



Marriage Minute

From the Gottman Institue, the Marriage Minute is a resource of tools based on research and clinical experience. Sign up to receive this newlestter in your inbox every Tuesday and Thursday. 

https://www.gottman.com/marriage-minute/



Find a Couples Therapist

Looking for a couples therapist? This guide from the Gottman Institute can guide you in finding the right provider for you and your partner. 

https://www.gottman.com/couples/find-a-therapist/



Gottman Card Decks App

Available on iTunes and the Google Play store, this app from the Gottman Institute offers research-based questions, statements, and ideas from improving your relationship. 

https://www.gottman.com/couples/apps/

UVA and Charlottesville Guide from Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Affairs

It takes a while to get fully settled in Charlottesville, but you can follow this guide to get better acquainted with all that the town has to offer!

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/uva-and-charlottesville-guide



@UVA Organizations

Interested in meeting people with similar interests? Check out UVA's graduate and postdoc organizations!

https://atuva.student.virginia.edu/organizations

Graduate Student Affinity Groups

Looking for people with similar backgrounds and identities? Check out UVA's Graduate Student Affinity Groups!

https://graddiversity.virginia.edu/student-affinity-groups



Charlottesville Young Professionals

CSP focuses on socializing with the group and continually being involved in the community.

https://www.meetup.com/cspinc/

Lean on Me UVA

Provides peer-to-peer text lines that allow for easy access to confidential non-crisis support. Anytime you feel lonely and need someone to talk to, Lean on me will be there.

https://lean0n.me/uva/



Graduate Students Support Group

This on-going group is open to graduate students and students of professional schools. Members will strive to provide a safe and confidential setting where the experiences of being a graduate/professional student can be freely discussed and support as well as coping strategies provided. A meeting with the group facilitator is required prior to joining the group.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/CAPS-groups

Mobile Safety App

A mobile app with resources for safety that includes a "SafeWalk" feature. 

https://safetyandsecurity.virginia.edu/mobile-safety-app

The Organization for UnderRepresented Students 


The Organization for UnderRepresented Students (OURS) is focused on providing a safe space for Ph.D. students from underrepresented backgrounds to come together and discuss the unique challenges faced.

https://graddiversity.virginia.edu/student-affinity-groups/organization-underrepresented-students



Womens Initiative -- Sister Circle

Sister Circle offers a social support group to meet the needs of people from across the African diaspora who identify as women in various ways: one of which being, recognizing the unique mental health challenges and trauma created by anti-Black racism and systemic oppression of BIPOC individuals.

https://thewomensinitiative.org/sister-circle



Graduate Student Affinity Groups

Looking for people with similar backgrounds and identities? Check out UVA's Graduate Student Affinity Groups!

https://graddiversity.virginia.edu/student-affinity-groups



PFLAG

PFLAG is the "first and largest" organization for supporting and affirming the LGTBQ+ community with over 400 chapters, including one in Charlottesvile. They provide confidential peer support, education, and advocacy for individuals who identify as LGBTQ+ and their allies. 

https://pflag.org/



The Activists' Guide

The Activists' Guide is a Charlottesville based organization that hat connects activists across the community and provides with resources such as activists' techniques and a newsletter, and more!

https://www.law.virginia.edu/public-service/community-and-activism



Jefferson School African American Heritage Center

Located in the Jefferson School City Center near the Downtown Mall, the African American Heritage Center works to honor and preserve the history of African Americans in Charlottesville. They host events, exhibitions, education opportunities, and so much more.  

https://jeffschoolheritagecenter.org

BIPOC Mental Health and Wellness Resources from the UVA Women's Center

Check out this comprehensive guide for BIPOC mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center at UVA.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/1/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1529019313&single=true



LGBTQ+ Mental Health and Wellness Resources from the UVA Women's Center

Check out this comprehensive guide for LGBTQ+ mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center at UVA.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1628978054&single=true



Sister Circle's 10 Self-Care Tips for Black Women

Looking to engage in some self-care? Here's 10 ways you can!

https://static1.squarespace.com/static/50a50853e4b013b04b89ffc5/t/5ed80f43b6b8fc226c25e275/1591218015612/2020-06+Sister+Circle+Self-Care+Tips.pdf



Wellness Tools from the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective 

Explore different ways that you can care for your emotional and mental health with these resources compiled by the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective.

https://www.beam.community/tool-kits-education

Talking About Race

Conversations about race are important -- here's a guide from the National Museum of African-American History and Culture that can help you navigate them.

https://nmaahc.si.edu/learn/talking-about-race



The Guide to Allyship

Interetsed in learning what it takes to be an effective ally? Here's a guide. 

https://guidetoallyship.com/?fbclid=IwAR1TfKMWgVCGshdjbJaT7z5ZgVPGa76i0mzOmSVmzOgEdosOJ0j4UPFKOcQ



UNC Project READY: Allies and Antiracism

Project Ready is a free online professional development curriculum provides information about how to be an ally and engage in anti-racist work. 

https://ready.web.unc.edu/section-1-foundations/module-13-allies-antiracism/



Supporting Asian American Individuals

Here's a CNBC article on some ways you can support individuals that identify as Asian American, particularly in the wake of anti-Asian violence during the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/19/how-to-support-asian-american-colleagues-amid-anti-asian-violence.html



Allyship and Activism Resources for the Black Community

This Google doc provides tips and strategies to engage in efffective anti-racist activism as well as educational resources such as books, movies, and podcasts. 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Oh6BuEqhU9y1Zrpp4Z8vVQNDYYjSB_MJTNu18PaAGls/mobilebasic



LGBTQIA Allyship Tips from UC Davs

This site provides general resources tied to providing allyship to trans, intersex and asexual communities.  

https://lgbtqia.ucdavis.edu/educated/ally-tips

Community and Activism - UVA Law

If you are a student of UVA Law and interested in activism, you can get involved with a bunch of different activism-based organizations such as the Feminist Legal Forum, the Human Rights Study Project, and more!

https://www.law.virginia.edu/public-service/community-and-activism



The Charlottesville Activists' Guide

The Activists' Guide is a Charlottesville based organization that hat connects activists across the community and provides with resources such as activists' techniques and a newsletter, and more!

https://www.law.virginia.edu/public-service/community-and-activism



Black Lives Matter

Black Lives Matter is a global network of activists whose mission is to eradicate white supremacy and empower Black communities. 

https://blacklivesmatter.com/about/



Human Rights Campaign

The Human Rights Campaign is a group striving to create equality for the LGBTQ+ community in the U.S. and worldwide, specifically those who are trans, people of color, and HIV+. 

https://www.hrc.org/



PFLAG

PFLAG is the "first and largest" organization for supporting and affirming the LGTBQ+ community with over 400 chapters, including one in Charlottesvile. They provide confidential peer support, education, and advocacy for individuals who identify as LGBTQ+ and their allies. 

https://pflag.org/



Black Girls Code

Black Girls Code is an organization that aids young women of color in learning skills such as leadership and innovation within the world of STEM. They have many opportunities to volunteer such as being an instructor or assistant, photography, and more! Join your local chapter today. 

https://www.blackgirlscode.com



NAACP

One of the oldest activism groups, NAACP hopes to achieve equality, both socially and politically, through the eradication of discrimination while securing the academic and economic well-being of Black people

https://naacp.org/



5 Calls

Want to demand change from your representatives but not sure where to start? 5 Calls can help demystify the process! Just enter your location, choose issues that are important to you, and the website will tell you who to call and what to say. 

https://5calls.org/



The Equity Center

The UVA Democracy Initiative Center for the Redress of Inequity through Community Engaged Scholarship (aka The Equity Center) represents a new model of community engaged scholarship, imagining the university as not just an anchor institution, but also an authentic community resource. Their work community partnerships and advocacy within the University work in tandem to create a more equitable culture. 

https://virginiaequitycenter.org/



UVA Voices of Equity

Voices of Equity is an interactive library that contains 50 years of documents addressing racial inequity at UVA. You can explore their interactive timeline, examine trends through their analyses, and even request that additional documents be added to their website. Join the conversation today!

https://voicesforequity.virginiaequitycenter.org



Jefferson School African American Heritage Center

Located in the Jefferson School City Center near the Downtown Mall, the African American Heritage Center works to honor and preserve the history of African Americans in Charlottesville. They host events, exhibitions, education opportunities, and so much more.  

https://jeffschoolheritagecenter.org

University Ombuds

Ombuds is an independent, confidential resource that can assist faculty in resolving problems, complaints, conflicts, and other issues. 

https://eocr.virginia.edu/ombuds



Title IX and Sexual Misconduct

Use this tool to initiate a Title IX or sexual misconduct complaint and/or learn more about the process of filing and the resources that are available to you. 

https://eocr.virginia.edu/reporting-prohibited-conduct-students



Just Report It

Faculty, students, staff, and employees may report an incident of bias/discrimination/harassment, hazing, sexual assault, sexual exploitation, intimate partner violence, stalking, sexual or gender-based harassment, complicity, or retaliation using Just Report It, the University's online incident reporting system.

https://justreportit.virginia.edu/



Reporting Discrimination and Harassment 

Use this tool to learn more about the process of filing a discrmiination or harassment complaint and/or initiate the process of filing a complaint. 

https://eocr.virginia.edu/discrimination-and-harassment



Office for Equal Opportunity and Civil Rights

The UVA Office for Equal Opportunity and Civil Rights (EOCR) works to ensure equal opportunity and protect the civil rights of all University community members. Through EOCR, you can learn more about the process of reporting instances of mistreatment, discrimination, or harassment and initiate the process of reporting if you choose to do so.

https://eocr.virginia.edu/
